alert.note: Alert for Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Linn County through 730 PM CDT... At 701 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prairieburg to near Center Point. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hiawatha, Robins, Center Point, Central City, Palo, Alburnett, Coggon, Prairieburg, Toddville, Waubeek, Paris, Buffalo Creek Park, Howard H Cherry Scout Reservation, Pleasant Creek State Recreation Area, Linn County Fairgrounds, Pinicon Ridge Park and Lafayette. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 26 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
